chargeHist.descr: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

Cases called at 2:07 PM: 21CF1047, 21CF1396, 22CF112, 22CF897.
Defendant Kelly M. Peck in custody and in court with Attorney James H Krave.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives her right to Preliminary Hearing in 22CF897. Branch 3 to schedule ARGNs.

Conditions:
No contact with co-defendant J.W., J.C. or iHeartMedia.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.
(Covers 22CF879, 20CF1554, 21CF1047, 21CF1396, 22CF112)

(11:23 AM cases 20CF1554, 21CF1047, 21CF1396, 22CF112, 22CF897 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kelly M. Peck appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Kelly M. Peck. 
Court orders the warrants are quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF897.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
State requests $2,500.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests low cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $2,500.00 cash bond with conditions to cover all files and all previous conditions remain.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(2:30 PM cases 20CF1554, 21CF1047, 21CF1396, 22CF112 called.)  All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kelly M. Peck not in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Kelly M. Peck. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Attorney Krave advises this hearing was scheduled via his assistant and contact was attempted with the defendant.
Attorney Krave advises defendant was provided with notice for today's hearing.
Court notes prior warrants and non-appearances for the defendant.
Court orders warrants.

10:14 AM Cases 22CF112, 21CF1047, 20CF1554, 21CF1396 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kelly M. Peck appeared by video, Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Kelly M. Peck. 
In all files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
All files are referred to Branch 3 to schedule ARGN.

(Cases 2CF112, 21CF1396, 21CF1047, 20CF1554 are called at 9:39 AM) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kelly M. Peck does not appear in court, Attorney James H Krave appeared in court for Kelly M. Peck. 
Attorney has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant. Warrant ordered. 

(Cases 2CF112, 21CF1396, 21CF1047, 20CF1554 are recalled at 10:11 AM) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kelly M. Peck appeared in court, Attorney James H Krave appeared in court for Kelly M. Peck. 
Warrant quashed. Defense waives reading of the Complaint in 22CF112. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived in 22CF112. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 2/23/2022 at 2:45 PM.  Hearing: 03/01/2022 at 9:30 AM. (Court approves Zoom)

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
No use or possession of firearms or dangerous weapons.  
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
